thread.title: ABC News rushes out DNC release on SCOTUS nominee Neil Gorsuch before he’s done speaking
thread.title_full: ABC News rushes out DNC release on SCOTUS nominee Neil Gorsuch before he’s done speaking

author: Brett T.
title: ABC News rushes out DNC release on SCOTUS nominee Neil Gorsuch before he’s done speaking
text:
ABC News rushes out DNC release on SCOTUS nominee Neil Gorsuch before he’s done speaking Posted at 8:39 pm on January 31, 2017 by Brett T. 
CNN had its notorious countdown clock going most of the day in anticipation of President Donald Trump’s announcement of his Supreme Court nominee, and Trump didn’t keep people waiting. BREAKING: President Donald Trump nominates Neil Gorsuch to the U.S. Supreme Court pic.twitter.com/TowEhTwky7 
— The Associated Press (@AP) February 1, 2017 "So, was that a surprise? Was it?" Trump asks. 
— David Freddoso (@freddoso) February 1, 2017 "Was that a surprise? Was it?" @realDonaldTrump on keeping his choice quiet. Good hints but no real leak. 
— Kelly O'Donnell (@KellyO) February 1, 2017 
Trump did manage to keep people guessing up until the last minute, leaving pundits and media outlets to prepare more than one set of talking points to send out. Has everyone prepared their "this is the most [insert one: extreme/sound] Supreme Court pick in decades" press releases? 
— Gabriel Malor (@gabrielmalor) February 1, 2017 
ABC News might have been the first mainstream news outlet to ship the Democratic National Committee’s objections, even before Gorsuch had finished his brief remarks. Pres. Trump says Gorsuch was confirmed to Court of Appeals by Senate "unanimously"—"can you believe that, nowadays, with what's going on?" pic.twitter.com/6pd09jl0tZ 
— ABC News Politics (@ABCPolitics) February 1, 2017 DNC: Judge Gorsuch "spent his career representing big corporate clients against the interests of ordinary Americans" https://t.co/dnihhSHPcR pic.twitter.com/IzAlOa72cM 
— ABC News Politics (@ABCPolitics) February 1, 2017 
Dems had already threatened a filibuster regardless of the pick; why wait to make the case to the public? @ABCPolitics Wow. That was fast.
